bio.summary: Frédéric Chapellier said Fred Chapellier, born June 4, 1966 in Metz , is a guitarist, songwriter and performer. Fred Chapellier born June 4, 1966 in Metz , began playing the guitar in 1981 . After a few years of training, he began to turn with his first blues band "Kashmir" (1992 to 1997) before forming the group "Men in Blue" with Big Joe Barret. But Fred feels the need to give expression freely to his music, thus in 1999 he decided to form his final group "Fred Chapellier Blues Band". Read more on Last.fm
bio.content: Frédéric Chapellier said Fred Chapellier, born June 4, 1966 in Metz , is a guitarist, songwriter and performer. Fred Chapellier born June 4, 1966 in Metz , began playing the guitar in 1981 . After a few years of training, he began to turn with his first blues band "Kashmir" (1992 to 1997) before forming the group "Men in Blue" with Big Joe Barret. But Fred feels the need to give expression freely to his music, thus in 1999 he decided to form his final group "Fred Chapellier Blues Band". In 2004, "Fred Chapellier blues band" is definitely FRED CHAPELLIER. Exit the words "blues band", because if Fred is undoubtedly influenced by the music, it is equally important for the Soul and Rock. It is with these three musical styles he built his own music. After two albums in French: "devil Blues" in 2003 and "The Eye of the blues" in 2005 . Fred pays tribute to his favorite guitarist, the late Roy Buchanan in his album "Chapellier Fred & friends, a tribute to Roy Buchanan", published in 2007 . In 2009, Fred joined forces with Billy Price, singer Roy Buchanan . Their album Night Work "released under the label DixieFrog sees criticism be excellent on both sides of the Atlantic [ref. needed] . So that Night Work will take the top spot in the Powerblues X.Roads magazine in France and enter into fifth position of American blues charts, to hit the top spot for several weeks [ref. needed] . Fred is well recognized not only by Europeans, but also by the American public. In 2010, it was alongside Jacques Dutronc , Fred on a tour of 89 dates. A live cd & dvd of this tour: And you, and you, and you came out in October 2010. 2011 is the year of the collaboration. Fred shared the stage with his friends and Neal Black Nico Wayne Toussaint for a series of concerts. The same year, Fred and his friend Tom Principato, guitarist Washington DC meet for a tour of 15 dates, which give birth to "live at home Paulette." In February 2012, Fred participated in Memphis (Tennessee) , where he represented France at the International Blues Challenge. One hundred and fifty groups from around the world compete in clubs Beale street for 8 days. Fred goes to the semifinals. A team of France 2 was followed and carried a 25-minute documentary on his American adventure. This report, released in May will bring together more than 4 million viewers. On 23 October 2012, his album "Electric Fingers" appears under the label DixieFrog . Official Website: Fred Chapellier Read more on Last.fm.
